page.title: 14 LOCAL HISTORY - cont'd
page.content: Welder & Hardware - Robinson In the past goods were conveyed by horse & cart up to Longcliffe Wharf - From there: Stone - from quarries was exported Bricks - from Friden and Harborough Milk produced locally was sent to Manchester. Delivered to the wharf: Coal for use by villagers Brewers grains - Corn - supplies for shops. Newspapers which came on milk train from Manchester. Local folk would frequently walk to Wirksworth on market day. Very occasionally they would walk to Wirksworth,catchthe 8o'clock train to Derby - return from Derby on the milk train in the evening and still had to walk back to Brassington. Sometimes had lift in van (tin-lizzie) for 2s6d.
